author: terencechain
content:
Am I correct in the following?
- If the builder reveals at 6s mark. IL committee will have 6s to build and broadcast the individual inclusion list
- If the builder reveals the aggregated inclusion list at 6s mark. Beacon attesters (next slot) will have 9s to verify the aggregated inclusion list

author: potuz
content: Not if you want builders for the next slot to know the boundaries. With the above (way above) definitions of `x`, IL committee has 6-x

author: terencechain
content: Oh sorry, I clearly missed that. The IL committee and builder need to figure out how to split the 6s together.

author: soispoke
content: I think it's still important to know so we can set "x"  (i.e., the time between IL deadline and Request bids, but I agree it doesn't address IL validation

author: potuz
content: Yeah, we seem to agree that there's a tradeoff and that there may be some slack to cut out time from payload validation. I sill would prefer an IL design that does not require less time than the protocol without the IL to validate the payload. Most importantly: since the IL validation issue is not solved, then we may as well use forward FOCIL ILs, whose main issue would be the same unsolved IL validation, but would not have any tradeoffs with `x > 0`
